text: Playbook: Jim Jordan's day of reckoning  —  Presented by With help from Eli Okun and Garrett Ross  —  DRIVING THE DAY  —  STILL TAKING APPLICATIONS — “How House Speaker Became Washington's Most Miserable Job,” by Ian Ward: “'You basically have a tied House with no operational majority,' said [political scientist MATTHEW] GREEN.

10/17/23 ☀️ Punchbowl News AM  —  Jim Jordan has problems.  —  The Ohio Republican plans to head to the floor today for a speaker election with more than a dozen GOP lawmakers saying they'll vote against him or are undecided about his candidacy.

The Apotheosis of Jim Jordan Is a Sight to Behold  —  No problem in the American system at this moment is as acute and disruptive as the one posed by the Republican Party.  —  Yes, of course, there are any number of structural problems facing American politics.

‘Everything Is Just Stuck.’ No Matter What Happens to Jim Jordan, the Next Speaker Is In For a World of Trouble.  —  An expert on House speakers explains how changes in campaign finance, media, and the type of people who get elected created the current debacle.

Jim Jordan's day of reckoning  —  Good morning, Early Birds.  We appreciate that Rep. Derek Kilmer (D-Wash.) has apologized for making puns on Twitter (sorry, X) but fear he might not be entirely sincere.  Tips: earlytips@washpost.com.  Was this forwarded to you?  Sign up here.  Thanks for waking up with us.

Democrats craft strategy to make GOP pay at the ballot box if Jim Jordan is elected speaker  —  A memo first shared with NBC News advises Democrats about how to cast Republicans as beholden to Donald Trump and “extremism” should Jordan become speaker.  —  WASHINGTON — Democrats …

House likely to vote today on Jim Jordan for speaker  —  The House is expected to vote Tuesday afternoon on whether to make Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) its next speaker.  Jordan, a conservative firebrand who is allied with former president Donald Trump, was chosen by fellow Republicans on Friday …

Rep Jasmine Crockett Says Dems are ‘the Adults’ Amid GOP Speaker Battle: ‘They Always Expect Us To Fix Their Mess’  —  The Texas lawmaker claimed there's a ‘double standard’ for the two major parties as Jim Jordan attempts to replace Kevin McCarthy … Rep. Jasmine Crockett, D-Texas …

President Joe Biden will visit Israel in high-stakes trip  —  US President Joe Biden will visit Israel on Wednesday, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced in the early hours of Tuesday from Tel Aviv.  —  Biden had been deliberating whether to make a wartime visit to Israel …

'There's just no excitement': Retail politics takes a nosedive in a Trump-dominated campaign  —  Operatives and activists can't recall a recent cycle with so little grassroots campaigning.  The numbers back them up.  —  If the Republican presidential primary this year is putting you half to sleep, you're not alone.

21 species removed from endangered list due to extinction, U.S. wildlife officials say  —  Nearly two dozen species are being taken off the endangered species list because they are extinct, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service said Monday.  —  Most of the species were listed under …

Ukraine uses secretly shipped U.S. missiles to launch surprise strike  —  The delivery and use on the battlefield marks a major ramp up of the administration's defense of Ukraine.  —  The Ukrainian military on Tuesday used U.S.-supplied longer-range missiles to strike nine Russian helicopters …

America's zombie “crime wave”  —  Judd Legum, Tesnim Zekeria, and Rebecca Crosby  —  The outset of the pandemic in 2020 coincided with a surge in violent crime in the United States, with murder rates rising particularly dramatically.  According to a lot of people with large megaphones, this crime wave continues today.

'We can't wait for the House'  —  Chuck Schumer is instructing three top Democratic committee leaders to hammer out a deal with Republicans on an aid package for Israel that could pass in the coming weeks.  The leading Democratic negotiators: Appropriations Chair Patty Murray …

Greta Thunberg detained at Fossil Free London protest  —  Greta Thunberg has been detained during a Fossil Free London protest.  —  The Swedish climate campaigner had joined other activists outside the InterContinental Hotel on Park Lane where oil executives were meeting.
